info.title: Hixbe Certification & Badge API
info.description: A comprehensive API for issuing, managing, and verifying digital certificates and badges. Perfect for educational institutions, certification bodies, and organizations requiring verifiable credential management. Supports certificate templates, digital badges, credential lifecycle management, public verification, webhooks, and comprehensive audit logging.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description: Certificate template management - create and manage reusable certificate designs

tags.name: Credentials
tags.description: Issued credential management - view and track digital certificates and badges

tags.name: Badges
tags.description: Digital badge definitions - create and manage badge metadata and criteria

tags.name: Verification
tags.description: Public credential verification - validate issued certificates and badges

tags.name: Issuance
tags.description: Credential issuance - create and distribute digital certificates and badges

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Event notifications - configure webhooks for credential lifecycle events

tags.name: Audit Logs
tags.description: Activity tracking - comprehensive audit trail for all credential operations

tags.name: Programs
tags.description: Certification programs - organize credentials into structured programs

tags.name: Revocation
tags.description: Credential revocation - invalidate certificates and badges when necessary

get.description: Retrieve a list of all certificate templates available in your organization. Templates define the visual design and field structure for certificates.

post.description: Create a new certificate template with custom background image and field definitions. Templates are reusable designs for issuing certificates.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all credentials issued by your organization, including certificates and badges. Use this endpoint to track issued credentials and their current status.

post.description: Issue a new digital certificate or badge to a recipient. The credential will be generated based on the specified template and recipient information. An email notification will be sent to the recipient with their credential details.

get.description: Public endpoint to verify the authenticity and current status of a digital certificate or badge. This endpoint can be used by third parties to validate credentials without authentication.

schema.description: Unique identifier of the credential to verify

post.description: Revoke a previously issued credential, marking it as invalid. This action cannot be undone. The credential will no longer be verifiable and the recipient will be notified if webhooks are configured.

schema.description: Unique identifier of the credential to revoke

get.description: Retrieve a list of all digital badge definitions in your organization. Badges are metadata definitions that can be used when issuing credentials.

post.description: Create a new digital badge definition with metadata including name, image, and earning criteria. Badge definitions are reusable templates for issuing achievement badges.

example.name: Certified Expert
example.criteria: Successfully complete advanced certification exam with 90% or higher score

get.description: Retrieve a list of all certification programs in your organization. Programs help organize related credentials and track learning pathways.

post.description: Create a new certification program to organize related credentials. Programs provide structure for learning pathways and credential hierarchies.

example.name: Advanced Cybersecurity Certification
example.description: Comprehensive program covering network security, ethical hacking, and compliance frameworks

post.description: Register a webhook endpoint to receive real-time notifications about credential events such as issuance, revocation, and verification attempts. Webhooks help you stay updated on credential lifecycle changes.

get.description: Retrieve a comprehensive audit trail of all credential-related activities in your organization. This includes credential issuance, revocation, verification attempts, and administrative actions for compliance and security purposes.

CreateTemplateRequest.description: Request payload for creating a new certificate template

name.description: Display name for the certificate template

background_url.description: URL to the background image for the certificate

fields.description: Array of field names that can be populated when issuing certificates

created_at.description: Timestamp when the template was created

ListTemplatesResponse.description: Response containing a list of certificate templates

IssueCredentialRequest.description: Request payload for issuing a new credential

email.description: Email address of the recipient for notifications

template_id.description: ID of the template to use for this credential

metadata.description: Additional custom data to include with the credential

expire_at.description: Optional expiration date for the credential

id.description: Unique identifier for the issued credential

verify_url.description: Public URL for verifying this credential

ListCredentialsResponse.description: Response containing a list of issued credentials

valid.description: Whether the credential is valid and authentic

issued_at.description: Timestamp when the credential was issued

revoked.description: Whether the credential has been revoked

revoked_at.description: Timestamp when the credential was revoked

CreateBadgeRequest.description: Request payload for creating a new badge definition

criteria.description: Description of how to earn this badge
criteria.example: Successfully complete advanced certification exam with 90% or higher score

id.description: Unique identifier for the badge definition

ListBadgesResponse.description: Response containing a list of badge definitions

CreateProgramRequest.description: Request payload for creating a new certification program

name.description: Display name for the certification program

description.description: Detailed description of the certification program
description.example: Comprehensive program covering network security, ethical hacking, and compliance frameworks

ListProgramsResponse.description: Response containing a list of certification programs

CreateWebhookRequest.description: Request payload for creating a webhook endpoint

url.description: HTTPS URL where webhook events will be sent

events.description: Array of event types to subscribe to

id.description: Unique identifier for the webhook endpoint

url.description: URL where webhook events are sent

actor.description: Identifier of the user or system that performed the action

message.example: The credential ID provided is invalid

code.description: Optional error code for programmatic handling
